subject: [TEST] JTest v4.5 and what is says about JUnit
msgSnippet: I have evaluated JTest version 4.5 and here are some JUnit related results: 1) JTest allows you to incorporate existing JUnit test with the JTest analysis 2)
messageBody:
I have evaluated JTest version 4.5 and here are some JUnit related
results:

1) JTest allows you to incorporate existing JUnit test with the JTest
analysis
2) JTest can generate a JUnit template for particular classes, it
doesn't go any further than this
3) Running JTest on junit.jar version 3.7 reports 24 runtime
exceptions (see below)
4) Running JTest on Ant produces 255 runtime exceptions
5) You can't analyze JTest using JTest, it refuses to analyze
"com.parasoft" packages (probably because you would find >>> 255
errors)

All in all JUnit wise the support is somewhat disappointing to me and
the 'Runtime Exception generator' facility is annoying.

Greetings,
A. Roy
Java QA tester

--- Junit 3.7 report -----
All Errors Found - done - 94 Errors Found
[ 24 ] Uncaught Runtime Exceptions

[ 18 ] java.lang.NullPointerException

[ 1 ] java.lang.StackOverflowError

[ 1 ] junit.framework.AssertionFailedError

[ 1 ] java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException

[ 1 ] java.lang.ClassFormatError

[ 1 ] java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

[ 1 ] java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
